definitions.definition: To physically place (something or someone somewhere).
examples: She put her books on the table.
The police put him in a cell.
They put the new motorway right through the national park.

definitions.definition: To place in abstract; to attach or attribute; to assign.
examples: The government put restrictions on vehicle imports.
I put £100 on the winning horse.
Don't put the blame on me.
What answer did you put for question 3?
to put a wrong construction on an act or expression

definitions.definition: To bring or set (into a certain relation , state or condition ).
examples: Put your house in order!
He is putting all his energy into this one task.
She tends to put herself in dangerous situations.
The doctor's put me on a strict diet.
Put the following sentences into the past tense.
put to bed ; put to shame ; put to death ; put into practice ; put one's mind to it

definitions.definition: To express (something in a certain manner).
examples: When you put it that way, I guess I can see your point.
To put it bluntly, he's an idiot.

definitions.definition: To set before one for judgment , acceptance , or rejection ; to bring to the attention .
examples: I put it to you, Sir, that you are a thief and a liar.
to put a question; to put a case

definitions.definition: To set as a calculation or estimate .
examples: They have put the cost of repairs at around £10 million.

definitions.definition: To steer; to direct one's course; to go.
examples: to put to sea

definitions.definition: To sell (assets) under the terms of a put option .
examples: He got out of his Procter and Gamble bet by putting his shares at 80.

definitions.definition: To throw with a pushing motion, especially in reference to the sport of shot put . ( Do not confuse with putt . )
examples: He put the shot out beyond the 20-metre mark.

definitions.definition: To play a card or a hand in the game called "put".
To lay down; to give up; to surrender.
To incite; to entice; to urge; to constrain; to oblige.
To convey coal in the mine, as for example from the working to the tramway .

main_definition: To physically place (something or someone somewhere).
secondary_definitions: To place in abstract; to attach or attribute; to assign.
To bring or set (into a certain relation , state or condition ).
To express (something in a certain manner).
To set before one for judgment , acceptance , or rejection ; to bring to the attention .
To set as a calculation or estimate .
To steer; to direct one's course; to go.
( finance ) To sell (assets) under the terms of a put option .
( especially athletics ) To throw with a pushing motion, especially in reference to the sport of shot put . ( Do not confuse with putt . )
To play a card or a hand in the game called "put".
( obsolete ) To lay down; to give up; to surrender.
( obsolete ) To incite; to entice; to urge; to constrain; to oblige.
( mining ) To convey coal in the mine, as for example from the working to the tramway .
